meanings.definition: Having light rain falling in very fine drops.
meanings.sent1: The drizzlier weather made the grass wet.
meanings.sent2: It was a drizzlier day than yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The drizzlier rain made the flowers look like they were wearing tiny diamond necklaces.
meanings.sent4: The drizzlier sky seemed to weep tears of silver.
meanings.sent5: The drizzlier rain felt like a gentle mist on my skin.

meanings.definition: To rain lightly in very fine drops.
meanings.sent1: I hope it drizzlier soon; we need the plants watered.
meanings.sent2: It drizzliered all night, making the streets slick.
meanings.sent3: The weather forecast predicted it would drizzlier during the picnic, so we brought umbrellas just in case.
meanings.sent4: The tears drizzliered down her cheeks as she listened to the sad song.
meanings.sent5: The sky began to drizzlier, signaling the start of the rainy season.
